revised_title: Lithotomy Operation on Women: Techniques and Innovations
tldr: The article describes the author's experience with lithotomy operations on women, detailing his methods, instruments, and advancements in the field. The author discusses his lateral cutting technique, which he used on a widow named Neel in 1735, and later refined to include a single instrument that could be used on both men and women. The author also shares a surprising case of a young girl who recovered quickly from the operation. The article includes illustrations of the instruments used in the procedure.
